articles.headline: An Accidental Cattle Ranch Points the Way in Sustainable Farming
articles.snippet: The TomKat Ranch sells grass-fed beef, but it began as a way to try to get carbon back into the soil.
articles.abstract: The TomKat Ranch sells grass-fed beef, but it began as a way to try to get carbon back into the soil.
articles.lead_paragraph: PESCADERO, Calif. — When Tom Steyer first learned that his wife, Kat Taylor, wanted to sell beef from the cattle herd on their ranch here, he rolled his eyes.

articles.headline: Plan to Finance Philanthropy Shows the Power of a Simple Question
articles.snippet: Several ideas about using financial instruments and a for-profit approach in the world of nonprofits are now taking hold.
articles.abstract: Several ideas about using financial instruments and a for-profit approach in the world of nonprofits are now taking hold.

articles.headline: Skeptics See Euro Eroding European Unity
articles.snippet: As economic troubles drag on, critics say the currency is doing more harm than good to the dream of a unified Europe.
articles.abstract: As economic troubles drag on, critics say the currency is doing more harm than good to the dream of a unified Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Europe’s slow emergence from its second recession in the last five years is raising new questions about whether the euro currency is doing more harm than good.

articles.headline: New Consoles on the Way, but Gaming Isn’t the Same
articles.snippet: Sales of a new generation of consoles could be dented by tablets, smartphones and Facebook, which offer games at lower prices.
articles.abstract: Sales of a new generation of consoles could be dented by tablets, smartphones and Facebook, which offer games at lower prices.
articles.lead_paragraph: The new video game consoles from Sony and Microsoft about to hit store shelves are almost certain to be hot holiday gifts this year. The uncertainty for the games business is: What happens after Santa leaves?

articles.headline: Insurers Press for Way Around Healthcare.gov
articles.snippet: Senior White House officials say the administration is open to ways in which insurers can handle more enrollments and has stepped up efforts to make that possible.
articles.abstract: Senior White House officials say the administration is open to ways in which insurers can handle more enrollments and has stepped up efforts to make that possible.
articles.lead_paragraph: Some major health insurers are so worried about the Obama administration’s ability to fix its troubled health care website that they are pushing the government to create a shortcut that would allow them to enroll people entitled to subsidies directly rather than through the federal system.
articles.byline: By Reed Abelson, Sharon LaFraniere and Susanne Craig
